Hey Mori :cat-wave:
This is an existing issue related to trial box users. We’re seeing failing <https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/board-query/u1uhnirWb5H/result/pQrWocHVGGi|logs> for PCS v1 as well. for example, the `pre-checkout.cutSelectionUsingPcs` trace shows failures on <https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/7da8cfcabb39dce071d2609bd120d528053c5a7c/app/data-access/pre-checkout/cutSelectionUsingPcs.ts#L49|v1> endpoint, with a count of ~4 during the 20% rollout.

Since trial box users, shouldn’t be calling PCS v1 or v2 at all.
We’re creating a <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3025|ticket> on our side to address this separately at a later time.
cc: <@U027201FQSV>

messages.text:
Hey team, *<@U01U67XD681>* needs support! :goodchop_fan:Please check the details.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

*Priority:* Low :large_green_circle: 
*Topic:* Other, General Support Request


:mag: *Issue reported:*
Hey team, got a question on how you guys handle triggering meal selection for customers that reactivate? If you could explain the flow/point me to the code I'd be super gr8ful :praycat:


:footprints: *Steps to reproduce:*
/////

elements.text: Hey team, got a question on how you guys handle triggering meal selection for customers that reactivate? If you could explain the flow/point me to the code I'd be super gr8ful

_thread_replies.text:
Thanks for the report! We will get back to you as soon as possible :blobthumbsup:

Meanwhile, please check our <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/4049372305/How+tos|How-To section>. It might help you speed up the process depending on the type of the request.

elements.text: Thanks for the report! We will get back to you as soon as possible
. It might help you speed up the process depending on the type of the request.

_thread_replies.text: Hi <@U01U67XD681>, i’m not very familiar with the flow, but i will ask my team and we will get back to you

elements.text: , i’m not very familiar with the flow, but i will ask my team and we will get back to you

_thread_replies.text: thank you, appreciate it :praycat: :blobheart:

hey suzi, what do you mean by handle triggering meal selection that reactivate exactly?

currently when customer reactivate it we send them to the dashboard with the same meal selection they had before (if they keep at the same plan)

elements.text:
hey suzi, what do you mean by handle triggering meal selection that reactivate exactly?

currently when customer reactivate it we send them to the dashboard with the same meal selection they had before (if they keep at the same plan)

_thread_replies.text: we’re using the same codebase from the other brands, one of the parent components would be this ReactivationContent <https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/pages/settings/src/components/Reactivation/ReactivationContent.tsx|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitel[…]es/settings/src/components/Reactivation/ReactivationContent.tsx>

elements.text: we’re using the same codebase from the other brands, one of the parent components would be this ReactivationContent

_thread_replies.text: i see that TPT doesn’t have a reactivation page. customers reactivate it right away from the dashboard with a CTA click. are you trying to get context around adding a reactivation page or something else? just to better understand how we can support you :)

elements.text: i see that TPT doesn’t have a reactivation page. customers reactivate it right away from the dashboard with a CTA click. are you trying to get context around adding a reactivation page or something else? just to better understand how we can support you :)

_thread_replies.text: I'm trying to understand how you handle the propagation of meal selection for customers that reactivate their accounts. The flow currently is user creates a subscription and selects their meals, meal selection is propagated to the last week menu thats available on CCM, lets say W45. What happens when that user deactivates their account and reactivates past W45 to a week where their previous meal selection hasn't been propagated to so no selection is done for that week, lets say W47 - do you handle this case by triggering meal selection so that its propagated to the rest of the weeks?

elements.text: I'm trying to understand how you handle the propagation of meal selection for customers that reactivate their accounts. The flow currently is user creates a subscription and selects their meals, meal selection is propagated to the last week menu thats available on CCM, lets say W45. What happens when that user deactivates their account and reactivates past W45 to a week where their previous meal selection hasn't been propagated to so no selection is done for that week, lets say W47 - do you handle this case by triggering meal selection so that its propagated to the rest of the weeks?

_thread_replies.text:
Hey all, we have synced with <@U01U67XD681> in the office and clarified the question :white_check_mark:

Summary: We don't have any user flow during the reactivation, when we allow customers to select meals before they reactivate.
• If they still have recurring selection (via CRS) available in menu, we keep it
• If not, they are getting a default selection

elements.text: Hey all, we have synced with
in the office and clarified the question
Summary: We don't have any user flow during the reactivation, when we allow customers to select meals before they reactivate.
If they still have recurring selection (via CRS) available in menu, we keep it
If not, they are getting a default selection

_thread_replies.text: yes thanks <@U027201FQSV> - will check with VMS to see how they're handling this scenario if at all and as discussed will report back with my findings :saluting_face:

elements.text: - will check with VMS to see how they're handling this scenario if at all and as discussed will report back with my findings

_thread_replies.text: <@U018UCEFJ65> /resolve

Circling back - VMS didn't cover this flow however it would be easier for them to come up with a solution since VMS users' SKU is actually the source of truth for which meal selection the user has made so they can just trigger a save request whenever the user reactivates. But for TPT and GoC we have no way of telling what the selection was and will be given the default selection. I'll discuss w the team on possible solutions (most likely prompting the user to make a meal selection upon reactivation)

elements.text: Circling back - VMS didn't cover this flow however it would be easier for them to come up with a solution since VMS users' SKU is actually the source of truth for which meal selection the user has made so they can just trigger a save request whenever the user reactivates. But for TPT and GoC we have no way of telling what the selection was and will be given the default selection. I'll discuss w the team on possible solutions (most likely prompting the user to make a meal selection upon reactivation)

_thread_replies.text: and something else I thought of, even if the user reactivates and their delivery still has the correct selection e.g. for W45, we still need to trigger meal selection so that the propagation can cover for the future weeks where the selection was not propagated to, for example lets say a users' meal selection is saved for all weeks up until W46 > user deactivates their account > user reactivates their account on W45 so they have their selection saved for W45 + W46 however for week W47 the selection will be lost so no matter what we need to trigger a meal selection for all users that reactivate to make sure that all weeks have the correct selection

elements.text: and something else I thought of, even if the user reactivates and their delivery still has the correct selection e.g. for W45, we still need to trigger meal selection so that the propagation can cover for the future weeks where the selection was not propagated to, for example lets say a users' meal selection is saved for all weeks up until W46 > user deactivates their account > user reactivates their account on W45 so they have their selection saved for W45 + W46 however for week W47 the selection will be lost so no matter what we need to trigger a meal selection for all users that reactivate to make sure that all weeks have the correct selection
